title: Hurting small creators
text:
I don‚Äôt want to give Instagram a one star because overall I like the app, and if you‚Äôre a casual user this won‚Äôt matter, but if you‚Äôre a small creator who wants to grow a platform on Instagram, READ THIS.

As of recent, they‚Äôve been pushing out updates that actively suppress smaller creators, even if this isn‚Äôt their intention. First it was the removal of chronological feed, and, as of recent, the removal of the recent posts option under hashtags. While yes, you can filter it through recent top posts, it still only shows the top ones. This makes it much more difficult for smaller creators to branch out and build and audience, and I‚Äôve also heard that people are getting shadowbanned for apparently no reason, but this is something I can‚Äôt verify. Basically, long story short, it‚Äôs nearly impossible for small creators to grow and get views the way they used to because their art is blocked by the top posts. There‚Äôs nothing wrong with having a top posts option, but instagram should bring back the ability to filter through recent posts, regardless of the amount of attention and engagement they‚Äôve received. Every update it seems to get worse. It doesn‚Äôt affect my enjoyment of the app overall, but this is something that should change if they intend for this to be a platform where smaller creators have the chance to grow alongside other ones, and it‚Äôs something that is significantly impacting a large portion of their user base.

title: What a shame
text: Instagram, once a beacon of inspiration and creativity for photographers, has become a mere shell of its former self. The platform, which used to showcase high-quality photography, now promotes meaningless content that is more focused on vanity and self-promotion than anything else. The platform has lost touch with its roots and no longer values the art of photography. Instead, Instagram has shifted its focus to more superficial trends, such as filters and gimmicks, which have little to do with actual photography. It seems that Instagram is more concerned with monetizing its platform than celebrating the creators who helped make it popular in the first place. It is also disappointing to see that Instagram has taken to smearing other platforms, such as TikTok, in a desperate attempt to remain relevant. Instead of focusing on creating a platform that values its creators, Instagram is wasting its money and resources on trying to discredit its competitors. It's time for Instagram to wake up and start appreciating its users and the value they bring to the platform. Instead of focusing on advertising and gimmicks, Instagram should be investing in the creators who helped build the platform's success. By doing so, Instagram can become the leader in the industry once again and regain the respect of photographers worldwide.
